title: I feel Magus was better than Runeglaive. (MY OPINION)
body:
So, in today's meta, the top AP junglers are as follows. Nidalee, Elise, and Diana. The reason they excel is because they rely on spamming their abilities and then auto attacking afterwards. 

Lets take a step back to season 4. Magus was still in the game.  Anyone who wanted to jungle AP, could. This allowed Fiddle, Karthus, Nidalee, Diana, Elise (NERFED AT THE TIME), Akali, and Karma, to all be viable. When they removed magus for an AUTO ATTACK based damage amplifier, they altered four of these champions. 

Karthus and Fiddle, for example, now have to auto attack to deal damage to a camp. (And for Fiddle it lowers his clear time 35%. Yes i did the math for real.) (Karthus has the slowest auto attack animation in the game. This DEVASTATED his jungling ability.)

Why I bring this up:
I played a game about three days ago where I was playing jungle fiddlesticks. I noticed now that he has a hard time clearing the camps when he has to stop and auto attack. (This is when I went into a custom game to calculate how slow it took and then compared it to a youtube video's clear speed of magus.)
I felt as if, in every aspect, the only VIABLE ability power junglers were being forced down my throat. I compared all the other junglers' clear times and noticed how Elise, Nidalee, and Diana ALL gained valuable buffs to their kits with ruinglaive added. (Elise may not be reliable in this aspect as she was NERFED when magus was removed.) I really felt like these champions were GIVEN their ability to succeed and Riot took the others away. I feel ruinglaive  really take away from Ability Power jungling and its diversity. 

What I feel should happen: 
Maybe alter the makings of Runeglaive to BETTER fit all AP champions when they jungle. Perhaps give them a DOT that scales with level. (FOR INSTANCE: Put 25dmg/second for 4 seconds at level 6. 65dmg/second at level 12. 100 dmg/second at level 18. All damage is magic damage.) ( I dont want this to be OP so please comment how it could be tweaked to balance.) The damage DoT would apply once magic damage has commenced and it only can apply ever 6 seconds. (WOULDNT APPLY TO MINIONS. AP {{champion:81}} WILL NOT RETURN.)

Again this is simply my opinion I don't mean this in any rant form or anything.

EDIT: I meant it to say Fiddle's EARLY GAME Clears. *MY BAD*

Exactly!

In my opinion, Runeglaive is the less bad option of two equally bad options.

Theoretically, Magus could be used by any AP jungler. Problem was, there really weren't any AP junglers. The only viable AP junglers were the AP champions that could both clear well in the early game and didn't have severe mana problems in the mid game either by having mana-efficient enough clears that Trailblazer could fix those problems by itself or because Trailblazer and a mana item or two could fix those problems and your champion had a strong enough early game it didn't matter whether you lost power early game due to those mana items.

Runeglaive made it so that a larger subset of AP champions COULD jungle by removing those mid-game mana constraints, with the exception of a few extreme outliers. The problem? Runeglaive was not nearly as universal a fit as Magus was. Not every champion wanted to use a sheen proc in PVP combat, and those that did were the AP assassins that were already strong in the jungle, while Runeglaive's sheen proc normalizes the clear speed of every champion in the jungle to similar speeds (except for Fiddlesticks and maybe Karthus (don't forget Karthus can still technically auto attack between Q casts)), meaning that the only time clearing strengths matter is the early game. That gives us the same jungling champion pool we had with Magus, except it doesn't have Fiddlesticks, because even though more champions could jungle isn't the same thing as more champions being good junglers.

Personally, I've had a lot of fun playing Runeglaive. I had fun trying out some almost-there jungle picks like {{champion:90}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:143}}  and some more off-the-wall jungle picks like {{champion:112}} {{champion:99}}  that are all viable almost exclusively because of Runeglaive's mana regeneration, but I've also accepted that Runeglaive isn't good for diversity.

We can't have Magus or Runeglaive because they both reduce diversity in their own ways. We can't have both because it still restricts diversity to those that are already good. We need a new item that promotes diversity without restricting it the way either of those items did.

I think neither Magus nor Runeglaive are the best fit for AP junglers. As you mentioned, Runeglaive only caters to a small fraction of AP junglers who were already advantaged when clearing (i.e. by blending autoattacks in with spells), to the detriment of mages, but at the same time Magus was just a boring enchantment that didn't offer anything unique to AP junglers and was often sold or ignored entirely in favor of Morellonomicon. I also think there's a deeper issue of early clears being so painful for mages, regardless of which enchantment they get, that it would prevent them from becoming as popular as, say, {{champion:131}} or {{champion:60}}, even if they get the perfect enchantment afterwards.

Your idea of giving AP champions a DoT to help them clear sounds good, and I think that could actually be brought right down to Hunter's Machete: since the item already has a DoT, giving it an AP ratio would allow AP champions (and only AP champions) to have a better time clearing right from the get-go, and would solve the core issue of mages suffering in the jungle due to having large cooldown and mana gates to their spells early on. Aside from that, I think the ideal AP jungle enchantment should probably mirror Luden's Echo: moving, autoattacking and dealing spell damage would build up charges, with the charge generation increased against monsters, and at 100 charges your next instance of spell damage deals bonus damage, scaling with AP (perhaps even max health damage, to  help burstier mages deal with tough monsters, as well as have some more gold- and target-agnostic power), though to just one target, likely the most wounded and prioritizing champions and large monsters. Since AP junglers tend to be better at inflicting AoE damage than most other champions, but often have a tough time dealing with big monsters when their cooldowns are down, it would allow mages to clear more smoothly, while still benefiting AP autoattackers as well.
Just make the Machete's passive effect proc on spells.

i would also like to point out how runeglaive is riots way of giving mage junglers a source of mana which works alright cus everyone should be weaving in autos while clearing, even karthus.

i can see a struggle where you get to 6 items and runeglaive doesn't really feel like an item you want anymore but you might still want your smite and that sucks but i don't think the focus of runeglaive should be on the buffed autos cus the item is efficient without it.

My advice would be don't build runeglaive at all, just build other ap items and go with those.

previously, there were more options for ap junglers but aside from fiddle, they were all subpar to warrior generally - with there are fewer, but the ones who benefit with it can really shine.

I used to run jungle {{champion:84}} but now there is nothing you can use for a jungle item on her. Runeglaive actually makes her deal a lot less damage then if you got the old magus, gunblade or even a lichbane and it also reduces her spellvamp noticeably as well. She doesn't need the wave clear either since trailblaizer smite is the go to for her anyway because she has plenty enough damage and sticking power not to mention you can smite nearby minions in skirmishes for extra spellvamp. I tried her with the warrior enchant using the gunblade/triforce build that was popular after her e nerf and before her compensation buffs and that also felt extremely lackluster. I feel really bad for anyone who play Fiddlesticks who are now forced to play a wannabe Amumu build with cinderhulk.

I play Diana jungle a lot now and I have to say Runeglaive is much better on her because she does run out of mana fast early on. Before with the Magus enchantment I had to get RoA after because I would run out of mana so fast in the jungle.

However, like most people, I agree that both Magus and Runeglaive should be in the game. Runeglaive is only good on champs that would buy Lich Bane regularly, and Magus worked really well other AP junglers like Fiddlesticks and Cho'Gath. AD junglers have both Warrior and Devourer so I did not see a point as to why Riot would remove Magus. Runeglaive surely does not work well with junglers that don't normally AA.

Sone advice for fiddle jungle is to just not enchant ever. Go spend your money on sonething useful like zhonyas. I don't think any fiddle main ever built runeglaive. 

But yeah I liked the cdr and extra 40 ap on magus far more than I liked the mana and aoe from runeglaive. For all they talk about diversity with their changes this season this eliminated all but 5 ap junglers from being viable and one of them doesn't even build a jungle item anymore. As much as jungle karthus/brand/karma weren't that great they were still off builds that were somewhat successful in the jungle but now can't really play because 40 ap is A LOT of damage early on for burst mages and since they don't auto that much in their normal gameplay, they are all but unplayable. 

They should've just given magus some mana-steal vs jungle camps

Depends on the champion. Some like Elise, Diana, and Nid received a clear buff. Then you look at others like Fid, Karthus, Malz, ect just sort of out in no mans land. Maybe part of the problem is they don't know what to do with champions like Fid. To be honest, I was an avid player of his before with Magus, but haven't even touched him since. I've heard some people build Cinder, other don't finish it, and some skip it all together. He seems to still have a decent winrate, but champs like Karthus are no where near where they were before. 

As others have said, there was no reason that they BOTH couldn't coexist. They both had the champions pools they worked with, and didn't really interfere with each other.

While Magus was kinda not interesting designwise, as it was giving only raw stats, nothing more (although it's gold efficiency was very high), the stats it gave were just fantastic for every AP champion able to jungle, thus, AP jungle diversity was just huge. But Runeglaive... it's just pathetic, while the sheen effect is interesting, it unfortunately completely narrows the number of viable junglers. It made freaking mid lane more diversive than jungle (Runeglaive Ezreal, Nasus, Gankplank, the craze was real). I hope Riot will make a new jungle item in preseason specifically for non-autoattacking junglers, I'm with you, Fiddle, jungle Brand and jungle Karthus mains.

As long as you do ONE autoattack every 3s, rune is better than magus.

Eh, say what you want about Runeglaive being too specific but when Magus was around there was not a single AP jungler in the meta aside from Nidalee. Runeglaive appeared and Diana, Elise and AP Evelynn all became viable choices. 

Fiddle has suffered, sure, but people like Karma and Akali were never going to be truly "viable", they were just fun off-roles you could play. I'd rather have 4 genuinely good AP junglers than 8 "playable in normals" AP junglers, and Magus was only doing the latter.

The only one hurt by Magus being gone is Fiddle. And now I don't have to see retarded stuff like AP jungle Tristana or Karthus anymore. 

Good trade off IMO
